posts.name: Ace
posts.cooked:
We are starting an FRC team in the 2026 season and we just took the manipulators off of this years ftc bot, essentially stripping it down to a super fancy drivebase with aesthetics. We had an FRC team a decade ago and used those old parts to make a ‚Äúgo-kart‚Äù at the end of last year.

Would it be possible for me to take the roborio from that go-kart and hook it up to our mecanum drivebase so we could learn/practice coding for FRC ? The one thing is that we used the imu in the control hub an I assume there‚Äôs no way to use that with the roborio, but we could buy an imu ofc.

posts.name: guineawheek
posts.cooked:
Yes. You can control the motors over PWM with external motor controllers such as these and power the Rio over 12v. The quadrature encoders can be wired up to the DIO ports for feedback.

You‚Äôll also need an external radio as well but otherwise it should work.

Inseason you likely do not want to run mecanum but this should be a decent start for now.

posts.name: garyk
posts.cooked: Yes. You‚Äôll need to set up a development PC and Drivers Station from back then - or you‚Äôve already got them for your go-kart? If your team‚Äôs been around a while somewhere you‚Äôll have a box of PWM motor controllers.

posts.name: Jim Sokoloff
posts.cooked: Assuming it‚Äôs a RoboRio (released ~2015) and not a cRio, I‚Äôd just reimage the Rio to 2025 and use all current software and libs. Will be way easier/cleaner/closer to next year‚Äôs experience.

posts.name: garyk
posts.cooked: Oh - does your go-kart have a roboRIO, or cRIO?

posts.name: Ace
posts.cooked: to my understanding we have a roborio, we had one season of FRC (recycle rush) and the team died right after

posts.name: Ace
posts.cooked: i think our gokart uses talons? if thats what you mean

posts.name: Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)
posts.cooked:
AceTheAro:

i think our gokart uses talons?

There could be two kinds of Talons on the remnants of a 2015 robot:

Talon SRX is a CAN -capable motor controller with some extra onboard capabilities for closed-loop control.  This one has integrated power leads and signal cables coming out of the body, and a data port on top.

Talon SR (or just Talon, before that) is a basic PWM motor controller, not unlike a SPARKmini in FTC .  Not a bad thing to have, they‚Äôre tough to kill.  These have screw terminals on the sides, and an open port for a PWM cable.

Either would run an FTC robot easily, but the methods might change a bit depending on what you have.

posts.name: Ada T
posts.cooked: That is the roborio inaugural year, and it‚Äôs most likely you have regular talons or talon srs, can you attach a photo?

posts.name: Ace
posts.cooked: turns out its the talon sr

posts.name: Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)
posts.cooked:
That helps! You have options here.

Run the FTC motor to the Talon SRs, like you would a SPARKmini.  If you want to use the encoders, wire them to the DIO pins of the roboRIO.

Source a motor controller that can accept the motors‚Äô encoder input directly, which is the more common way to go about it in modern FRC .  Valid answers include the CTRE Talon SRX, CTRE Talon FXS, REV SPARK MAX, or Thrifty Nova. The good news is that the SRX is mostly obsolete in FRC as it‚Äôs the only one in that group which can‚Äôt run brushless motors, so you can probably find them from a nearby FRC team for the low price of asking nicely.  You can find them for about $50 each on eBay if nobody has them collecting dust in the closet.

The good news is that the SRX is mostly obsolete in FRC as it‚Äôs the only one in that group which can‚Äôt run brushless motors, so you can probably find them from a nearby FRC team for the low price of asking nicely.  You can find them for about $50 each on eBay if nobody has them collecting dust in the closet.

posts.name: Ace
posts.cooked: this honestly doesnt seem super hard? with the right wiring and potentially seeing if my friends at 321 have talonSRX‚Äôs and then from there its just a coding journey

posts.name: Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)
posts.cooked:
Pretty much.  I know a few folks have grafted FRC control systems onto the AndyMark TileRunner chassis just because they wanted a very portable setup for testing.  And in the fever dream that was the 2021 at-home season, 1678 ran a heavily-modified TreadRunner chassis to run an eight-motor tank drive setup (which isn‚Äôt even legal anymore, and was hilarious back then).

The sooner you start wrapping your head around this, the more dividends you‚Äôll reap come 2026!
